required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tow Techniques of Adductor Canal Block for Analgesia After Total Knee Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound-guided Continuous Adductor Canal Block for Analgesia After Total Knee Replacement: Comparison of Block at the Entrance and Middle of the Canal

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the tow technique of continues adductor canal block for total knee replacement surgery. Half participants will receive catheterization at the entrance of the adductor canal, while the other half will receive catheterization at the middle point of the adductor canal.

primary_outcome.measure: cumulative sulfentanil consumption at 24 hours after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Quadriceps strength was assessed on a 0-5 scale as per the Medical Research Council Scale quadriceps motor strength(0 = no voluntary contraction possible, 1 = muscle flicker, but no movement of limb, 2 = active movement only with gravity eliminated, 3 = movement against gravity but without resistance, 4 = movement possible against some resistance and 5 = normal motor strength against resistance)

secondary_outcome.measure: The pain scores at rest determined by the numeric rating scale (NRS, 0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: 11-point numerical rating scale (NRS; 0, no pain; 10, maximum pain imaginable).

secondary_outcome.measure: The pain scores on adduction of the keen determined by the numeric rating scale (NRS, 0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: 11-point numerical rating scale (NRS; 0, no pain; 10, maximum pain imaginable).

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV)

secondary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with anesthesia was assessed using a 5-point scale (5, very satisfied; 4, satisfied; 3, neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 2, dissatisfied; 1, very dissatisfied)
Record complications including catheter dislodgment, puncture point infection, leakage,falling down,et al.

secondary_outcome.measure: cumulative sulfentanil consumption at other time points after surgery

arm_group.arm_group_label: entrance placement of adductor canal catheter
middle point placement of adductor canal catheter

intervention.intervention_name: ultrasound-guided short-axis placement of catheter at the entrance of the adductor canal
intervention.description: Ultrasound probe is placed at the entrance of the adductor canal in short axis ï¼Œinsertion of a PAJUNK Contiplex S catheter with the tip of the catheter located at the entrance of the canal
intervention.arm_group_label: entrance placement of adductor canal catheter

intervention.intervention_name: ultrasound-guided long-axis placement of catheter at the middle of the adductor canal
intervention.description: Ultrasound probe is placed at the middle of the adductor canal in long axis with the caphelad end of the probe aligned with the entrance of the canal. insertion of a PAJUNK Contiplex S catheter with the tip of the catheter located at the middle of the canal
intervention.arm_group_label: middle point placement of adductor canal catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-80 years
- Knee-arthroscopy
- Written consent
- ASA I-III
- BMI 19-35
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to communicate with the investigators (e.g., a language barrier or a neuropsychiatric disorder).
- coagulopathy or on anticoagulant medication
- Allergic reactions toward drugs used in the trial
- History of substance abuse
- Infection at injection site
- Can not be mobilised to 5 meters of walk pre-surgery
